pkgmetadata.longdescription: Testing and Detecting Multimodality using Bayesian Methods // The testing approach works in two stages. First, a mixture distribution is fitted on the data using a Sparse Finite Mixture (SFM) Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithm following Malsiner-Walli, Frhwirth-Schnatter and Grn (2016) doi:10.1007/s11222-014-9500-2). The number of mixture components does not have to be specified; it is estimated simultaneously with the mixture weights and components through the SFM approach. Second, the resulting MCMC output is used to calculate the number of modes and their locations following Basturk, Hoogerheide and van Dijk (2021) doi:10.2139/ssrn.3783351. Posterior probabilities are retrieved for both of these quantities providing a powerful tool for mode inference. Currently the package supports a flexible mixture of shifted Poisson distributions (see Basturk, Hoogerheide and van Dijk (2021) doi:10.2139/ssrn.3783351).
